elements.title: Antimonumento +72 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sculpture Antimonumento +72 (pictured), which commemorates a massacre that took place thirteen years ago today, was also a memorial for a March 2023 migrant center fire?

elements.title: John Ojukwu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to gain weight to increase his chance of being a college football offensive lineman, John Ojukwu went on a diet that included drinking a gallon of milk a day and sometimes whole pizzas?

elements.title: Oakdale Golf & Country Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Oakdale Golf & Country Club was founded, the Toronto Star ran a story with the headline "Hebrews buy farm; build golf course"?

elements.title: Joseph O'Callaghan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joseph O'Callaghan died at sea while carrying papers appointing him provincial superior?

elements.title: Salvation Army Headquarters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the current Salvation Army Headquarters replaced an earlier building that resembled a "medieval citadel"?

elements.title: Angela Ferrell-Zabala (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in early 2023 Angela Ferrell-Zabala became the first executive director for the US gun control advocacy organization Moms Demand Action?

elements.title: HeadOn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a commercial for HeadOn drew comparisons to Maoist posters, North Korean propaganda, and Hillary Clinton?

elements.title: William Maldon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Maldon learned to read, which resulted in him almost being killed by his father?
